com.algolia.instantsearch.ui.views

Class Hits

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.view.View
      • android.view.ViewGroup
        • android.support.v7.widget.RecyclerView
          • com.algolia.instantsearch.ui.views.Hits
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Drawable.Callback, NestedScrollingChild, ScrollingView, AccessibilityEventSource, KeyEvent.Callback, ViewManager, ViewParent, AlgoliaResultsListener, AlgoliaWidget

    public class Hits
extends RecyclerView
implements AlgoliaWidget
    Displays your search results in a flexible way. Built over a RecyclerView, it displays a limited window into a large data set of search results.

      • onResults

        public void onResults(SearchResults results,
                      boolean isLoadingMore)
        Description copied from interface: AlgoliaResultsListener
        Event listener to react to new hits.
        Specified by:
        onResults in interface AlgoliaResultsListener
        Parameters:
        results - a SearchResults object containing hits.
        isLoadingMore - true if these hits come from the same query than the previous ones.

      • setEmptyView

        public void setEmptyView(View emptyView)
        Specify an empty View to display instead of these Hits when they are empty. By default, we will search for a view with id @android:id/empty and will use it if it exists.
        Parameters:
        emptyView - the View you want to display when Hits are empty.

      • getHitsPerPage

        public Integer getHitsPerPage()
        Get the current hitsPerPage settings.
        Returns:
        the value of the attribute hitsPerPage if specified, else DEFAULT_HITS_PER_PAGE.

      • getLayoutId

        public int getLayoutId()
        Get the itemLayout layout identifier.
        Returns:
        the identifier of the layout referenced in itemLayout if specified, else 0.
